instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no boot. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
threads.message:
Hi all,

This is not a liquid damaged how ever <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> was burnt and missing. replaced <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR>/<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>/<RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5101</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5126</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR>/ <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> still smc reset is 0v. 
Removed <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> you get the green light and quater fan spins. Removed <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> still 0v. <CAPACITOR>C5126</CAPACITOR> comes 3v then gradually going down.

Please help me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no boot. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
threads.message:
If you get green light without U51110, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be 3V at that moment.
So post its voltages; all pins, less the ground one ;)
Test it with trackpad disconnected too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no boot. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
threads.message:
Thank you for your quick reply and helping me again.

pin 1 3.4v 2,3,4 0v , pin 8/6 0v. pin 5/5 3.4 v. this is <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no boot. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
threads.message: hi, this is marked as solved. Issue was no 3.4 line coming to <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR>. Thank you so mcuh for your help.
